scenario_text.value:
(Oh, Shuuji and the professor are analyzing
the murals.)
Professor! This place... Could it be?
Indeed. Well-noted, my boy.

(Heh... Shuuji’s like a professor-in-training
over here.)

Did you guys figure anything out from the
mural?
Oh. It’s you, Takuma.

Ho ho, were things that simple we would’ve
been rescued long ago.
Well...yeah. Good point.

Still, I’ve noticed something interesting.
What do you see when you look at this?
Umm... Vicious monsters on a rampage?

It’s more than that, Takuma. Can’t you see
houses and humans here?

Still, I’ve noticed something interesting.
What do you see when you look at this?

Ah, you’re right... It’s almost like they’re
running away from the monsters...
Yes, I view it the same way.

Perhaps these are monsters that ran rampant
in our world.

The professor also put together an
interesting hypothesis.

Ah, Shuuji, my boy. Perhaps now isn’t the
best time for such talk?
What sort of hypothesis?

Ah, well... It’s just, perhaps the Kemonogami
here were models for our creatures of legend—
Wh-what?! Are you serious?!

Merely a thought, my boy. Just a wild idea
drummed up from this mural’s data points.

*cough* Now, the next part is quite
important. What does this look like to you?

Ummm... This mural... It looks like a human
singing some sort of song.

And this thing drawn close to it...
A woman... Maybe a priestess?

In ancient times, young boys were taken from
Kamakura and offered to the Kemonogami.
Where did you hear that?

I read something about that in the archives
of the shrine back in our world.

Powers that be in the Kamakura era offered up
five youths to obtain the Kemonogami’s power.
Humans and Kemonogami coexisted?!

Apparently, if this mural and the historical
archives are to be trusted.

But of those offerings, one had a wicked
mind, causing the Kemonogami to turn savage.

...From here, the world of the Kemonogami
began its descent into madness.

Now, the four strongest Kemonogami seal those
savage beasts off from the four directions.
The...four strongest Kemonogami?

The mural within has shed some light on the
subject. About this mural...and this maiden.

The maiden is drawn much more clearly than
others—indication that she’s special somehow.
The maiden...
Professor?

Ah, apologies. It’s nothing. Now then, on to
the next mural.

You see what this is, Takuma? These two
separate areas, with humans and monsters...
This is...?

This mural could delineate the two worlds—
our world, and the one we’re in right now.

Oh okay, so the humans and Kemonogami each
live in their own world.

It’s not just about the worlds. There’s
something connecting the two, isn’t there?
Connecting the two... Could this be a gate?!

Most likely... Piedmon opened this gate to
lead an attack on our world, I’d guess.

My word, well done noticing that. When Shuuji
pointed it out, I was flabbergasted.

A gate... Does that mean there were others
like Miyuki who could connect the worlds?

Perhaps, or perhaps it was a common
technique... At any rate, now it is a lost art.
The evidence is in this mural.

What?! Humans and monsters are getting...
sucked into the gate?

I imagine the gate deteriorated over time,
flinging unfortunate souls between worlds.
Takuma... Doesn’t that sound familiar?
You mean...what happened to us?

Indeed. No doubt some of the disappearances
occurred when the gate malfunctioned.
The disappearances were caused by the gate?

Well, best to think of it as just one source
of information. Now, on to the next mural.

I was able to make some headway in my
investigation with Shuuji’s help. Even so...

This mural is quite indecipherable. The
situation depicted is too abstract.

Analyzing the top part here... This mural
seems to depict some kind of disturbance.
Yeah... These humans and monsters, right?
All of them seem to be freaking out.

Yes, many of them are upset due to some
incredible power...
That’s all I can tell from observation alone.
Each of the murals seems connected, but...

The problem is the timeline, right? We can’t
do anything without a basis for linearity.

Well, no need to fret over the knowledge we
lack. Come, let’s move on to the next mural.

Now, Takuma, do you recall the tale of beings
who suppressed the rampaging Kemonogami?
Oh! The four strongest Kemonogami!
Yes, exactly.

These Kemonogami share aspects of four god-
like beings in ancient legends...

I believe those gods protected the north,
south, east and west in ancient texts.

Four gods... If we can get Kemonogami like
that on our side, then...

But we can’t exactly count on the power of
those whose very existence is up in the air.
...You speak truly, my boy.
Four gods... Four Kemonogami...

(Hmm? I wonder if the professor’s caught on
to something?)

If only this story gave us some clue about
how to save Miyuki...
Indeed... If only.

Well, that’s all we’ve gleaned from our
investigation of this area.

The explanation was a bit rushed, I admit,
but what do you think? Any questions?
Oh, um, questions? Hmm...

(Oh right, I did have something to ask the
professor, didn’t I?)

(About the photo I saw back in the apartment
complex, and his talk with Garurumon.)

(Are the professor and Miyuki related
somehow? Will he even tell me if I ask?)
(What do I ask the professor about?)
About the photo I saw.
About Garurumon.
About him and Miyuki.
About the photo I saw.

What’s the deal with that photo I saw of
Miyuki and Haru in the apartment complex?
About Garurumon.

What did you talk about with Garurumon at the
apartment complex? You two looked tense...
About you and Miyuki.

Are you connected to Miyuki somehow? I mean,
there was that time at the apartments, and...

Oh, would you look at the time. We have to
get back to the school building.
Hey, Professor!

I know you have questions, but the answers
would be paltry at best.

You should stick to knowledge that will aid
in achieving our current goal.
...What was that all about?
It’s...nothing.

(I guess that means I shouldn’t stick my nose
where it doesn’t belong.)
Whoa!!!
Wh-what is it?!
Oh, sorry. It’s just my phone.
Your phone... You got a text?!

No, I just get some meaningless, garbled
texts from time to time.
Let’s see... Yep, just more gobbledygook.
Oh, I see...

I got one myself a few days ago. Same garbage
as you, though.
I see...

(...Huh? Is it my imagination, or are more
parts legible compared to last time?)

If you can’t read it, you can’t read it.
Might as well forget about it for now.

Come on, Takuma. We should head back to the
school ourselves.
Yeah, sure. Let’s go...
